name: Arya Marriage Validation Act, 1937
1:
Arya Marriage Validation Act, 19371. Short title and extent (1) This Act may be
called the Arya Marriage Validation Act, 1937. 2  [(2) It extends to the
whole of  India except 3[the
territories which, immediately before the
 1st November, 1956 , were comprised in Part B States] and applies also to
citizens of  India wherever they may
be.]
2:
Arya Marriage Validation Act, 19372. Marriage between Arya Samajists not to be invalid Notwithstanding any
provision of Hindu Law, usage or custom to the contrary no marriage contracted
whether before or after the commencement of this Act between two persons being
at the time of the marriage Arya Samajists shall be invalid or shall be deemed
ever to have been invalid by reason only of the fact that the parties at any
time belonged to different castes or different sub-castes of Hindus or that
either or both of the parties at any time before the marriage belonged to a
religion other than Hinduism.Foot Notes1. Extended to and
brought into force in Dadra and Nagar Haveli, with effect from 1st July, 1965 by Regulation 6 of 1963, section 2 and
Schedule I.2. Substituted by the
Adaptation of Laws 1950, for the former sub-section (2).3. Substituted by the
Adaptation of Laws (No. 3) Order, 1956, for the words "Part B
States".
